resources.string: Natasha oversees the major day to day external activities coming into the office and manges the Student Activity Center along with the staff from the Department of Campus Life. She also advises Fraternity and Sorority life, Student Government Association, and is the primary advisor for the National Society for Leadership and Success. NatashaHutson@mail.clayton.edu

Lakiesa handles the internal activities of Campus Life in relation to the campus. She also manages our major Multicultural and Diversity based programs and Leadership programs. She advises D.E.E.P. (Diversity Education Experiences for Peers). LakiesaCanteyRawlinson@mail.clayton.edu

LaShanda is our service learning, community outreach, and civic engagement expert. She coordinates service based programs for the student body and faculty. Ms. LaShanda advises Habitat for Humanity (nicknamed: \'abitat) and S.A.A.S. (Student African American Sisterhood). email@mail.clayton.edu

Jen is in charge of the CSU AmeriCorps program which holds over 30 active students; each serve the community in order to reach their goal of 900 service hours. Jen advises Alpha Phi Omega National Service Fraternity. email@mail.clayton.edu

Royal (preferred addressing) coordinates and organizes all recognized student organizations on campus. She is the creator of the RESET program and advisor of CEC (Campus Events Council). email@mail.clayton.edu
Amber coordinates reservations for events from internal and external clients..... this is not Amber...this is Shondo. email@mail.clayton.edu

array.name: titles
array.item: Red, Black, and Blue: Police Brutality or White Privilage

array.name: description
array.item: Summer is here and the sun is out! Time to go to the pool and have some fun. Join us as we gather for music and food.
Not enough parties in your life. Come by for music, free stuff, and games as we celebrate the first week of school.
We will address the current pace of police brutality across the United States. For more information, please contact Dr. Lakiesa Cantey-Rawlinson

It\'s the 6th Annual Diversity and Leadership Conference. Come experience different cultures and add Diversity training to your resume. There are plenty of reasons to expand your horizons. Sign up today by sending an e-mail to Dr. Lakiesa Cantey-Rawlinson.
Come network with your peers and get to know your professors. The Male Leadership Summit is your stop for networking, mentoring, and leadership in males here at CSU.
It\'s a potluck, it\'s a celebration! Music, food, and fun; ah, the ultimate combination!
